config.question: What was the cause of the rift between the Soviet Union and the West during World War II that exacerbated future tensions?

choices.content: American refusal to allow the Russians a share of the German war reparations
the Soviets fighting alone against the German army with only promises of American help
the U.S. blaming the Russians for having caused the German on slaught
British indifference to the plight of the Russians fleeing into British-held areas

answer_3.response: Consider This: The greatest strain of all within the wartime coalition was with the Soviet Union. Although Roosevelt had recognized the Soviet regime in 1933, ties were not close. The Russian refusal to pay prerevolutionary debts and Soviet support of communists in the United States in the 1930s intensified American distaste for Stalin’s regime. See L.O. 27.3 Turning the Tide Against the Axis.
